summary: This bill, HR 5186, authorizes the Secretary of Defense to establish a program focused on bolstering the defense biotechnology supply chain. The program aims to develop, scale, and transition biotechnology research from military labs, including bio-based materials and products. The Secretary is authorized to conduct supply chain vulnerability assessments, support research and development, upgrade infrastructure, and collaborate with various entities. The bill mandates plans, performance metrics, and annual reports to Congress, with a sunset clause after 10 years, potentially extended by the President.
